keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport via a social media livestream.
Cagle was apprehended at the airport after a tip from his family, who alerted authorities that he was streaming plans to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Law enforcement found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal.
Cagle was charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
The incident highlights the role of community vigilance and social media in preventing mass violence.
Cagle had a history of mental health struggles, including schizophrenia, and was reportedly taking medication.
The arrest was praised as a success due to early intervention by family and law enforcement, with officials crediting the family’s action for averting tragedy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted law enforcement that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Officers found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had disclosed schizophrenia and was reportedly on medication, was charged with multiple offenses including terroristic threats and unlawful firearm possession. The incident was averted due to early family intervention and police action, with officials praising the role of community vigilance and timely information sharing. The event underscores the importance of monitoring social media for signs of violent intent and the critical role of local and federal law enforcement in preventing mass violence.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Social Media Threat to Shoot Up Terminal
